title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco, 26, and Brandon Baez, 23, sentenced for bank fraud and mail theft in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco sentenced to 35 months, Baez to 24 months; both must pay restitution totaling $22,813.
From June 2023 to February 2024, they stole mailed checks, altered and redeposited them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen previously detained by ICE, will attend the State of the Union address.
Rep. Seth Moulton invited Gomes to highlight issues in the U.S. immigration system during President Trump's speech.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 on his way to volleyball practice after ICE targeted his father for arrest.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman conceded a center-ice goal but laughed off the moment after the U.S. win over Denmark.
Swayman cited losing sight of the puck due to a 'flash screen' as the reason for the embarrassing goal.
Swayman's start against Denmark might be his only one, with two other goalies available for Team USA.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum could return from his Achilles injury, with practice reps and possible G League play signaling progress.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony discussed Tatum's potential impact, highlighting his All-Star capabilities and depth added to Celtics.
The Celtics, currently second in the East, could strengthen playoff prospects with Tatum's anticipated return alongside Jaylen Brown.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots enter offseason with $41 million in cap space to address roster needs.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential free agent targets for New England.
Patriots may also consider Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips in free agency.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99 per season; non-subscribers pay $149.99 including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
An ESPN Unlimited subscription is not required to maintain MLB.TV after the free trial, but new MLB.TV subscribers must register via the ESPN app.
ESPN Unlimited is available through Fubo, DirecTV, Hulu+ Live TV, Verizon Fios, Spectrum, and Cox; an FAQ on ESPN's site aids sign-up.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum practiced with the Maine Celtics, increasing speculation about his potential return this season.
Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's progression in practice despite uncertainty about his season return.
Tatum participated in G League scrimmages and five-on-five sessions, but there's no set timetable for his return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 study.
Massachusetts leads in the percentage of adults with bachelor's (47%+) and graduate degrees (nearly 22%).
Vermont and Maryland secured second and third places, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Honus Wagner T206 card from early 1900s up for auction, with ties to Massachusetts and an estimated value of $4.75 million.
The card, owned by Morton Bernstein's family, was discovered intact and ungraded after being hidden for 116 years.
Auction hosted by Ken Goldin, Netflix's 'King of Collectibles', will close on February 21, possibly reaching over $6 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start as goalie for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
Swayman, a Boston Bruins player, previously helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship with a 5-0 record.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also compete for Team USA, which next faces Germany in the preliminary round.
